Description.Name: Warfront Rebalanced
Description.Details: A new Hyperpulse message appears at the Argo’s comms console, flagged with Watch encryption and marked “Priority Advisory – Strategic Update”. Sumire intercepts it immediately, eyebrows raised. “Message is from Arelle’s admin staff,” she says, already decrypting. “It’s… a theater-wide disposition report. Special bulletin.” The contents unfold over the holotable in stark, structured detail. [[DM.Factions[faction_GhostBearWatch],Ghost Bear Watch]] forces have successfully completed operations in Star Cluster 752, Horgens, and Outpost #11. All three systems are now considered secure and under Watch authority, with transition efforts underway and tactical networks re-established. But the report is more than just a victory log. Alongside the advances, it reveals that the [[DM.Factions[faction_MinnesotaTribe],Minnesota Tribe]] has simultaneously locked down a large amount of jump points across surrounding sectors—chokepoints, transit gates, even hidden routes once thought abandoned. These positions weren’t taken in response to the Watch's actions—they were part of a broader design, executed in parallel. The Watch now classifies several adjacent systems as “denied-access zones,” effectively cutting off a growing arc of space from routine operations. Sumire hits a quick succession of keys, with the computer replying with a series of beeps. “Star map’s updated. All logged and verified.” Darius looks at you, with a slight frown. “So what's the plan now, Commander?”

Description.Name: Head back to Melidron
Description.Details: Melidron reappears beneath the Argo’s orbit—red, scorched, and dust-choked, just as you left it. The planet’s surface flickers with faint geothermal signatures, and the old comms grid accepts your clearance codes without comment. No greetings. No warnings. Just a cold orbital lock and a view of a world that’s still smoldering with unfinished business.

Description.Name: Stay Here
Description.Details: <color=#BFBFBF>You are not sure what to do next as you wait for Arelle's next commands, but might as well look around while you are out here in the outer fringe of the Deep Periphery.</color>
